answers.answer: Could you be depressed or anxious?  have you had your adrenal glands checked?  Your thyroid?

Hello! I've had tests done for my thyroid, results came back fine. I wasent aware of adrenal glands; it seems like I'm having the effects of that so ill mention it to my doctor.My friend who has diabetes has checked my sugar levels frequently - he says it could be my sugars, as I'm always reading at the lower levels.I'm traveling at the moment so I can't go to my doctor just yet

question: Every other day I'm feeling lethargic and tired, I feel likeI'm living half asleep; I'm constantly being toldHow pale and tired I look, I get consistent sore throats, I find it hardTo concentrate and in conversations, I zone out quite a bit.I'm vegetarian; so I've been prescribed iron tablets and various other multi vitamins;Nothing has worked, I seem to be going round in circles with the doctors as they tell me I'm fine.I also suffer the effects of polycystic ovaries, not sure if that has anything to do with it?I've felt like this for years now and I'm desperate to find outWhat is wrong , many thanks!
title: Constantly feeling lethargic..
